intro: Chloracantha australis, commonly known as the Australian greenbark tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rutaceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its smooth, greenish bark and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, round fruits. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas and heathlands. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
